file_insights.changes_summary: Updated two grid layouts in skeleton loading states to be responsive

key_modifications.description: First grid changed from fixed 4-column layout to responsive: 1 column on mobile (xs), 2 columns on tablets (sm), 4 columns on desktop (md)
Second grid changed from fixed 2fr/1fr layout to responsive: 1 column on mobile (xs), 2-column ratio on large screens (lg)

patterns_discovered.description: Using MUI's sx prop with breakpoint-based object syntax for responsive grid layouts
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Breakpoint keys (xs, sm, md, lg) applied to gridTemplateColumns property

patterns_discovered.description: Mobile-first approach with graceful escalation: base mobile layout expanded for larger viewports
Ensuring loading placeholders match the responsive behavior of actual content layouts
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Skeleton grids adapt to same breakpoints as production grid layouts

gotchas_discovered.description: Different grids use different breakpoint thresholds (sm/md vs lg). Risk of visual inconsistency if not carefully coordinated with actual content grids
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify these breakpoint choices match the actual dashboard content grids being loaded

gotchas_discovered.description: Gap property remains constant (gap: 3) across all breakpoints. May need adjustment for very small screens to avoid cramped layouts
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Test on mobile devices to confirm gap spacing is adequate

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully implemented responsive grid layouts in DashboardPage skeleton loading states
key_accomplishments: Converted fixed 4-column grid to responsive 1→2→4 column progression
Converted fixed 2fr/1fr grid to responsive single-column mobile with dual-column desktop layout
Applied consistent MUI breakpoint syntax across both grid modifications
Maintained existing gap and styling properties while adding responsiveness
approach_outcome.completion_efficiency: Completed on first attempt without iterations

recommendations.recommendation: Cross-reference these skeleton grid breakpoints with the actual dashboard content grids to ensure alignment
recommendations.rationale: Skeleton states should visually match the responsive behavior of loaded content

recommendations.recommendation: Test responsive behavior across all breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg) on actual devices
recommendations.rationale: Ensure smooth transitions and proper grid behavior at each breakpoint

recommendations.recommendation: Document the chosen breakpoint strategy for skeleton loading states for consistency with future responsive updates
recommendations.rationale: Provides reference for maintaining responsiveness in other skeleton components

recommendations.recommendation: Consider making gap responsive as well (smaller gap on xs breakpoints) if visual testing shows spacing issues
recommendations.rationale: Could improve mobile UX by optimizing whitespace for smaller screens
